intro: Myosotis perennis var. sylvatica, commonly known as the woodland forget-me-not, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate blue-violet flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to August. The plant grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other small insects, contributing to its ecological significance in natural habitats.
